div.p: On Friday April 17th, Governor Abbott issued a resolution keeping all schools in Texas closed for face to face instruction for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Although we are disappointed that our students and teachers will not be able to finish the year in a traditional way, we understand and appreciate the safety measures that are in place to ensure everyone remains healthy. Burkburnett ISD will continue to deliver instruction utilizing the school at home format we currently have in place until the school year ends on May 22nd. It is important for all students to continue to participate in the day to day instruction provided by their teachers as well as complete all assignments through the end of the school year. Each campus administrationÂ is developing a plan to ensure any personal items students may have on campus are returned to the student. Those plans and additional information will be communicated to you by your childâ€™s campus principal in the coming weeks. We will also continue to follow our current meal distribution plan. We remain in close communication with local and state health authorities and will adjust our plan accordingly. If you have any questions, please contact your childâ€™s teacher or contact the district administrative offices. Thank you for your support of Burkburnett ISD.

hr.p: Our staff is dedicated to making our schools exceptional places to learn.Â We believe we can ensure this outcome by building supportive, positive relationships in a culture of academic excellence.Â All of us - from teachers, custodians, cafeteria workers, administrators, maintenance crew, instructional aides, computer technicians, office personnel and all other staff - are a team focused on supporting the continuedÂ academic and personal growth of each student.

We need one more very important part in our work and that partner is YOU.Â The success of our education system depends on our ability to continue building strong partnerships with businesses, families and community members.Â Working together, all of us have an important role in preparing our students for their future.

strong.span: A STAAR Score does not define a student!

span.style: font-family: Palanquin; font-size: 18px; font-weight: 200; text-align: left;

p.span: Burkburnett ISD believes the State of Texas Assessment of Academic Readiness (STAAR) is only a snapshot of one point in time in a student's academic career. A STAAR score does not define a student, is not a predictor of college or work-force readiness, and does not provide an accurate accounting of a child's learning and achievement. Assessment and accountability are important to all of us, but BISD believes the STAAR is not a test that should guide decisions about children or their learning. The STAAR is designed for rank ordering students and our students are much more to us than just a number.
